New Records: Ruben Trumpelmann became the first player in T20I history to take two wickets with the first two balls of a match.
Key Match Events: Ruben Trumpelmann dismissed opener Kashyap Prajapati and Oman's captain Aqib Ilyas for golden ducks.
Jan Frylinck anchored the innings with a steady 45 off 48 balls.
Namibia's Gerhard Erasmus and David Wiese smashed 21 runs to set a formidable target for Oman in the Super Over.
Oman managed only 10 runs in the Super Over, falling short of Namibia's target.
Pre-Game Insights: Namibia clinched a thrilling Super Over win against Oman to kick off their T20 World Cup campaign at the Kensington Oval.
Ruben Trumpelmann made history by becoming the first player in T20I history to take two wickets with the first two balls of a match.
Post-Match Reflections: Namibia's Gerhard Erasmus and David Wiese took charge, smashing 21 runs to set a formidable target for Oman in the Super Over.
With Wiese taking responsibility with the ball as well, Oman's response fell short as they managed only 10 runs, securing Namibia's thrilling victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Namibia's South Africa-born left-arm fast bowler, Ruben Trumpelmann, made history by becoming the first player in T20I history to take two wickets with the first two balls of a match.
This was the second Super Over in T20 World Cup history, following the first-ever between New Zealand and Sri Lanka in Kandy in 2012.
